channel.title: rstats on Data * Analysis + R
channel.description: Recent content in rstats on Data * Analysis + R

item.title: An R Little Secret! How could I live without it?
item.description: For many years I’ve been coding using dplyr functions and always get annoyde with conflict fuctions issues.

item.title: Be the Best at What Matters Most in Versioning Control
item.description: I won’t give you details on git version control tools. Instead, I’ll only ask you to commit to memory these few commands…

item.title: Bayesian Ideal Points Estimation
item.description: Packages you’ll need First of all, make sure you’ve a working C++ compiler in your machine; you’ll need it for Stan/rstan to work. # devtools::install_github("dmarcelino/SenadoBR") # devtools::install_github("rmcelreath/rethinking") library(readr) # pacakge for reading data library(rstan) # package for interacting with Stan (sampling over distributions) # library(rethinking) # package for interacting with Stan library(ggplot2) # package for plotting Introduction This tutorial will use data from the brazilian Senate, and build a comparison between two approaches very widespread in the political science studies.

item.title: Bolsonaro's First Job Approval Ratings
item.description: President Jair Bolsonaro’s job approval ratings average 39.5% during his first quarter in office so far.

item.title: ANOVA Simplified Using R
item.description: This is a minimal set of notes and examples that form the foundation of my introduction to the analysis of variance.

item.title: Soccer Predictions Using Bayesian Mixed Effects Models
item.description: Models developed for the prediction of individual games, European domestic leagues, and the UEFA Champions League.

item.title: Reading List Faster With parallel, doParallel, and pbapply
item.description: It’s important to realise that every bit of optimisation matters.

item.title: Cartography and Spatial Analysis
item.description: This project shows examples of how to produce maps in R, perform spatial analyses, and how to estimate centrographic statistics.

item.title: Will Brazil Goes to the Instant Runoff Election?
item.description: Pundits have been asking themselves over the last days if the Brazilian far-right candidate would win the election in the primary runoff.

item.title: Game of Thrones Analysis
item.description: A data analysis of Game of Thrones that determines who really is the main character.

item.title: May the Force of R be With You, Always!
item.description: With Telegram, the force of R can always be with me, where I have data.

item.title: The Effective Number of Parties in the Electorate by Year and Region
item.description: Using the American National Election Studies, compute the Effective Number of Parties in the electorate across regions and years/waves.

item.title: Yet the Worst Olympic Chart
item.description: The Olympics barely began but we already have the worst chart winner.

item.title: Mapping the Brexit Vote
item.description: This data project provides some insights, specially about the spacial distribution of the Leave vote across country. This project is not entirely finalized though. I still plan to overlap data from past elections and local opinion surveys data as they become available.

item.title: Mapping the Brexit Vote
item.description: This data project provides some insights, specially about the spacial distribution of the Leave vote across country. This project is not entirely finalized though. I still plan to overlap data from past elections and local opinion surveys data as they become available.

item.title: Data, Data, Data
item.description: Shows the distribution of therapeutic communities in Brazil.

item.title: Isn't sad that all that matters in an election is the candidate's height?
item.description: This post discusses the importance of candidates’ stature in US presidential elections.

item.title: A Bit More Fragmented
item.description: This entry discusses the legislative elections in Brazil, which turned out to produce one of the most fragmented parliament in the world.

item.title: Yep. He made it, the country voted No
item.description: This post talks big about my last predictions for the Referendum in Scotland.

item.title: Bayes says `don't worry` about Scotland's Referendum
item.description: This post uses Bayesian methods to show the anti-independence vote has an overwhelming advantage over the pro-independence side.

item.title: SciencesPo Package
item.description: This is a minimal set of notes and examples of using the R package SciencesPo: A Tool Set for Analyzing Political Behaviour Data.

item.title: FPTP2AV: Simulate Election Outcomes for Alternative Vote System Using the Actual FPTP Votes
item.description: This project was packaged and became a beta version for publication. The set of scripts simulates election outcomes under a different voting system. Taking First Past the Post (FPTP) votes as imputes, the package simulates hypothetical outcomes given the Alternative Vote System.

item.title: SoundexBR: Phonetic-Coding for Portuguese
item.description: This project was packaged in 2011 under the name: SoundexBR. The package provides an algorithm for decoding names into phonetic codes, as pronounced in Portuguese. The goal is for homophones to be encoded as the same representation, so that they can match despite minor differences in spelling.

item.title: Multilevel Analysis
item.description: Master dissertation submitted to the University of Brasilia, investigating the impact of campaign spending in the Brazilian elections. This work uses a lot multilevel analysis models.
